intro: Acranthera didymocarpa, commonly known as the twin-seeded acranthera, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and produces two-seeded capsules as its fruit. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it prefers a Mediterranean climate.
